## indexBy() function

Returns the spilted lists grouped by index. They key should be unique and for ununique keys it would be replaced with the last key.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function indexBy<Item extends {
    [Key in keyof Item]: string | number | symbol;
}, Key extends keyof Item>(array: Item[], key: Key): Record<Item[Key], Item>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

array


</td><td>

Item\[\]


</td><td>

of objects.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

key


</td><td>

Key


</td><td>

unique key


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

Record&lt;Item\[Key\], Item&gt;

grouped by index, key value list.

## Example


```ts
indexBy([
 { id: 1, name: "A" },
 { id: 2, name: "B" },
 { id: 3, name: "C" },
 ], 'id')
 // result:
 // {
 //  "1": { id: 1, name: "A" },
 //  "2": { id: 2, name: "B" },
 //  "3": { id: 3, name: "C" },
 // }
 indexBy([
 { id: 1, name: "A" },
 { id: 1, name: "B" },
 { id: 3, name: "C" },
 ], 'id')
 // result:
 // {
 //  "1": { id: 1, name: "B" },
 //  "3": { id: 3, name: "C" },
 // }
```
